intro: Impatiens nagorum, commonly known as the Nepal balsam, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and India. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 30 centimeters in height, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, spurred flowers. The flowers are typically pink to red in color and bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
